verses.roman:
pitā-mātā kāśī pāile udāsīna hañā
punaḥ prabhura ṭhāñi āilā gṛhādi chāḍiyā

synonyms: pitā-mātā—the father and mother; kāśī pāile—when they passed away at Kāśī (Vārāṇasī); udāsīna hañā—being indifferent; punaḥ—again; prabhura ṭhāñi—to Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu; āilā—returned; gṛha-ādi chāḍiyā—leaving all relationships with home.
translation: Then his parents died at Kāśī [Vārāṇasī], and he became detached. He therefore returned to Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu, giving up all relationships with his home.
